meanings.definition: A fatal flaw leading to the downfall of a tragic hero.
meanings.sent1: The hamartias of the main character in the play caused his tragic end.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the hamartias of the hero were his pride and arrogance.
meanings.sent3: The hamartias of the hero made the audience gasp in shock at the unexpected twist.
meanings.sent4: Her inability to trust others proved to be her hamartias, leading to her downfall.
meanings.sent5: The hamartias of the protagonist were like a dark shadow following him everywhere.

meanings.definition: The act of making a mistake or committing a sin.
meanings.sent1: Forgiveness is important when one acknowledges their hamartias.
meanings.sent2: Learning from our hamartias helps us grow as individuals.
meanings.sent3: The hamartias of the character added a touch of humor to the story.
meanings.sent4: His repeated hamartias were like a chain dragging him down.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of her hamartias were severe, but she vowed to do better.
